overview.title: Express Entry for French-speaking Skilled Workers
overview.description: Immigrate to Canada as a French-speaking skilled worker and play an important part in Canada's economy
benefits: Services for newcomers offered in French and English
One of the highest-quality education systems in the world

steps.title: Create Profile
steps.description: Create an online profile in the Express Entry pool
steps.details: You must be eligible for one of the immigration programs in Express Entry to get into the pool

steps.title: Earn Points
steps.description: Earn points based on your skills and experience
steps.details: Points are awarded for factors like age, education, work experience, and language proficiency

steps.title: Get Invited
steps.description: Receive an invitation to apply for permanent residence
steps.details: You need to have one of the highest-ranking scores to get an invitation

steps.title: Apply
steps.details: You have 60 days to submit your application after receiving an invitation

frenchLanguageBenefits.title: French Language Benefits
frenchLanguageBenefits.description: You can earn up to 50 additional points for strong French language skills

pointsBreakdown.condition: NCLC level 7+ in French + CLB 4 or lower in English
pointsBreakdown.description: 25 additional points if you scored CLB 4 or lower in English

pointsBreakdown.condition: NCLC level 7+ in French + CLB 5+ in English
pointsBreakdown.description: 50 additional points if you scored CLB 5 or higher on all four English skills

frenchLanguageBenefits.note: Even if French is your second language, you can still earn these points

eligiblePrograms.name: Federal Skilled Worker Program
eligiblePrograms.description: For skilled workers with foreign work experience
requirements: At least one year of continuous full-time work experience

eligiblePrograms.name: Federal Skilled Trades Program
eligiblePrograms.description: For skilled workers in specific trades
requirements: At least two years of full-time work experience in a skilled trade
Job offer or certificate of qualification

eligiblePrograms.name: Canadian Experience Class
eligiblePrograms.description: For skilled workers with Canadian work experience
requirements: At least one year of skilled work experience in Canada
Work experience must be gained legally

categoryBasedRounds.title: Category-based Rounds
categoryBasedRounds.description: Each year, we invite candidates who are eligible for specific categories to help meet economic goals

frenchCategory.title: French Language Proficiency Category
frenchCategory.description: French language proficiency is one of the chosen categories for 2025
frenchCategory.benefits: Additional opportunities for French-speaking candidates to receive invitations

overview.title: TEF Canada (Test d'Évaluation de Français pour le Canada)
overview.description: Assesses French proficiency for immigration purposes
overview.recognition: Recognized by IRCC as official proof for permanent residency and Canadian citizenship applications
overview.requirement: No diploma is required to take the exam

testModules.name: Compréhension de l'écrit
testModules.description: Tests your ability to understand written French texts

testModules.name: Compréhension de l'oral
testModules.description: Tests your ability to understand spoken French

testModules.name: Expression écrite
testModules.description: Tests your ability to write in French

testModules.name: Expression orale
testModules.description: Tests your ability to speak French

scoring.clbConversion: Scores are converted to Canadian Language Benchmarks (CLB)

registration.waitingPeriod: 30 days between two tests as per immigration rules

francophoneCommunities.title: Francophone Communities Outside Quebec
francophoneCommunities.description: Fourteen communities outside Quebec are going above and beyond to welcome and support French-speaking newcomers

studyTips: Practice all four language skills regularly
Take practice tests to familiarize yourself with the format
